meanings.definition: A surgical procedure in which a portion of the colon is diverted to an artificial opening in the abdominal wall.
meanings.sent1: After the colostomy, the patient's waste goes out through a new opening.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the colostomy as a way to help with digestion.
meanings.sent3: During the colostomy, the colon took a detour out of the body.
meanings.sent4: The colostomy was like a shortcut for waste to leave the body.
meanings.sent5: The colostomy changed the path of the colon dramatically.

meanings.definition: The opening created during a colostomy procedure.
meanings.sent1: The nurse checked the colostomy for any signs of infection.
meanings.sent2: The colostomy opening needed to be cleaned regularly to prevent complications.
meanings.sent3: The colostomy opening was like a small window to the inside of the body.
meanings.sent4: The colostomy opening served as a new exit for waste.
meanings.sent5: The colostomy opening was carefully monitored for any issues.
